title: Puppy trapped under rubble when Hurricane Dorian struck is found 'skeleton thin and unable to walk'
text:
A puppy has been found alive in the rubble of a building which collapsed when Hurricane Dorian ravaged the Bahamas a month ago.

The dog, now named Miracle, was found by members of Big Dog Ranch Rescue on Friday using infrared detection from a drone in Marsh Harbour.

Spokesperson Chase Scott said the one-year-old mixed breed had been surviving on rainwater.

A one-year-old dog has been rescued from the debris of a building which collapsed during Hurricane Dorian

He told CNN Miracle was nearly crushed to death after the building collapsed and was trapped under broken glass, debris and an air conditioning unit.

He said the puppy was 'skeleton thin and unable to walk' but still greeted rescuers with a wagging tail.

Scott said the team are providing Miracle with support and are hopeful of a full recovery.

He said: 'Miracle will be up for adoption following recovery, unless his owners claim him.

The rescue team are providing Miracle with support and are hopeful of a full recovery before they put it up for adoption

One of the rescuers said the puppy was 'skeleton thin and unable to walk' but still greeted rescuers with a wagging tail

'We have reunited some families who lost everything with their pets who they thought had died or were separated from them during evacuation and it gives them new hope.'

The Category 5 storm is estimated to have caused $7billion in damage, claimed the lives of at least 58 people and 600 are still missing.

The United Nations estimates that 76,000 people in Grand Bahama and the Abaco islands have been left homeless.
